criteria: Accuracy of Geometric Shapes: Assesses the precision and correctness of the drawn geometric shapes based on given conditions.

Understanding Triangle Conditions: Evaluates the student's ability to determine if the given conditions (three measures of angles or sides) result in a unique triangle, more than one triangle, or no triangle.
Construction Technique: Assesses the quality and precision of the construction techniques used (freehand, with ruler and protractor, and/or with technology).
descriptions: The geometric shapes are either not drawn or are completely inaccurate, showing no understanding of the given conditions.
The geometric shapes are attempted, but with significant inaccuracies and deviations from the given conditions.
The geometric shapes are partially accurate, with some noticeable errors or deviations from the given conditions.
The geometric shapes are mostly accurate, with only minor errors or deviations from the given conditions. Demonstrates a basic understanding of the properties.
The geometric shapes are accurate and well-constructed, with only slight imperfections. Demonstrates a good understanding of the properties and conditions.
The geometric shapes are perfectly accurate and precisely constructed, demonstrating an excellent understanding of the properties and conditions.
The student is unable to determine the type of triangle, or whether a triangle can exist given the conditions.
The student attempts to determine the type of triangle, but the reasoning is unclear and inaccurate.
The student shows some understanding, but with significant errors in identifying the type of triangle based on the given conditions.
The student can identify the type of triangle in most cases, with occasional errors. The reasoning is somewhat clear but may lack full justification.
The student consistently and accurately identifies the type of triangle, providing clear and logical reasoning based on the given conditions.
The student demonstrates a complete understanding of the triangle conditions, accurately identifying the type of triangle and providing a rigorous, clear, and concise justification.
The construction techniques are not used, or they are used incorrectly, resulting in inaccurate or poorly constructed shapes.
The construction techniques are attempted, but with significant errors and inconsistencies. The tools are used ineffectively.
The construction techniques are partially correct, with some noticeable errors or inconsistencies. The tools are used with limited proficiency.
The construction techniques are mostly correct, with only minor errors or inconsistencies. The tools are used with reasonable proficiency.
The construction techniques are accurate and precise, with only slight imperfections. Demonstrates a good command of the tools and methods.
The construction techniques are flawless, resulting in perfectly constructed shapes with precision and accuracy. Demonstrates mastery of the tools and methods.
